intro: Aklema colletioides, commonly known as the Cape ivy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its trailing growth habit and opposite, ovate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white or yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Aklema colletioides is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and ability to cascade from containers or rockeries.
